intro.title: How It All Started
intro.text: A few years ago, I felt like I was standing still ‚Äî I was missing growth, an engaged team, and projects that truly excited me. Then I accidentally stumbled upon a programming webinar. I joined ‚Äújust out of curiosity,‚Äù but quickly realized it was something for me ‚Äî logical, creative, and full of challenges. Within a few days, I decided to start learning.

first_steps.title: My First Steps in Programming
first_steps.text: From the beginning, I was fascinated by how code fits together like a puzzle. Every problem felt like a mini-challenge, every step meant growth, and the first results appeared almost instantly. Over time, I started to understand application architecture more deeply ‚Äî and it gave me huge satisfaction.

experience.title: Experiences That Shaped Me
experience.text: My previous experience turned out to be extremely valuable: working with quality systems taught me analytical and process-oriented thinking and documenting solutions; running a micro-business taught me organization and combining many requirements into one coherent system.

destillapp.title: DestillApp
destillapp.description:
A full-stack application designed to manage and document the distillation of aromatic plants. 
The system centralizes plant data, distillation batches, results, and user settings ‚Äî offering an efficient workflow for small-scale distillation studios or botanical research environments. 
Built with a modern TypeScript‚Äìpowered Vue 3 frontend and a GraphQL API backend, DestillationApp delivers a clean, structured, and reliable tool for handling the entire distillation lifecycle. 
Designed and implemented end-to-end as a solo project ‚Äî from concept and architecture to API design, UI development, documentation, and deployment preparation.

features.name: Authentication & Security
list: Secure JWT and bcrypt-based authentication
Route protection within the application
Sanitization of data sent to the database
Ability for users to change their password

features.name: Plant & Distillation Management
list: Managing plant inventory: add, edit, delete
Recording, editing, and deleting distillation processes
Assigning and managing distillation results
Filtering and sorting plants, distillations, and results by name or date

features.name: Frontend Application
list: Vue 3 + TypeScript for modular and typed components
Vuex for centralized state management
Apollo Client for communicating with the GraphQL backend
Selected Vuetify components and responsive design

features.name: GraphQL API Ecosystem
list: Modular architecture of GraphQL resolvers and schemas
Flexible management of distillation, plant, and result data
MongoDB and Mongoose for structured data modeling

features.name: Documentation & Code Quality
list: Automatic frontend documentation with VitePress
TypeDoc generating documentation for TypeScript files
JSDoc for backend modules and utilities
Frontend testing environment with Vitest

features.name: Error Monitoring
list: Sentry integration for frontend error reporting

responsibilities.overview: Since this was a solo project, I handled the entire development process:
list: Designed the full system architecture (frontend, backend, GraphQL API, data layer)
Created a complete user interface in Vue 3 and TypeScript, ensuring modularity and type safety.
Implemented all application logic using Vuex, Apollo Client, and Vuetify components
Developed the backend using Node.js, Express, and Apollo Server with a complete GraphQL schema
Created database models and data operations using MongoDB and Mongoose
Implemented secure JWT-based authentication with permission checks and data sanitization
Prepared technical documentation (VitePress, TypeDoc, JSDoc) and foundational unit testing setup (Vitest)
Integrated Sentry for error and performance monitoring
Collaborated with a DevOps engineer on deployment planning and workflow design

wallet-app.title: Wallet App

filmoteka.title: Filmoteka
filmoteka.description:
A team project as part of the GOIT course, creating a dynamic movie search application with trailer previews, detailed film information, and a personalized watchlist feature. 
Built using vanilla JavaScript with Axios for API communication, it follows a mobile-first approach and provides a responsive, interactive interface. 
Users can search for films, watch trailers, explore detailed descriptions, and manage their personal ‚Äúwatched‚Äù or ‚Äúto-watch‚Äù lists. 
This project demonstrates practical teamwork, frontend logic implementation, and integration of third-party libraries for UI and pagination enhancements.
